column4: Hm. / has suddenly become a read only file system. dmesg says http://pastebin.com/d62595a12
(And what do I need to do to fix this?)
back up your data and if it is backed up reboot and see if fsck can help, you may however have a flaky disk needing replacement
That's what I was afraid of... Thanks.
ok, fsck seems to have repaired things without any noticable adverse effects.
Anything I should check other than being paranoid about backing up for the immediate future?
I would back up, and repartition the drive, things like that always make me edge
Well, I've backed up. I'll probably leave off repartitioning for now, though you're probably right that it's a good idea.
and if anything happens again soon on that drive I would be looking at a new one
you were as they say "very lucky" and in Disaster Recovery there is the phrase, you just had a disaster and you think you are going to get lucky :-)
Mostly I'm lazy. I'll take steps to minimize potential consequences of that drive exploding and keep an eye on it. :)
there is good lazy (sysadmin stuff) and bad lazy doing nothing
Mm. At any rate, it's past midnight over here. I'm certainly not repartitioning the drive *now* :)
Anyway, thanks again. I'm going to vanish now. :)
